title: Associate already uploaded documents with an additional project
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
_General problem:_
Back in May, I uploaded several hundred documents to our doccano server, and assigned them to a particular sequence labeling project.  I have now created another sequence labeling project, and I want to use the *same* documents for this new project.  

_What I can do:_
I'm logged in as an administrator, and in the "Django administration" page I select "Documents" over on the left.  This shows the documents I previously uploaded, all assigned to the earlier project.  I click on the box next to "TEXT" just above this list, which selects the first 100 documents; I can additionally click on the "select all 742 documents" link.  

_What I would expect_: 
I would think I could then choose from the "Action" drop-down some action having to do with assigning the selected documents to another project.

_What happens instead_:
The only action under the "Action" drop-down is "Delete selected documents", which I don't want to do.

Do I need to re-import all 742 documents for the new project?

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment. -->

*   Operating System: Linux
*   Python Version Used: Python 3.8
*   When you install doccano: Apr 2021
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): official docker container
